Package edu.macalester.graphics

Class GraphicsObject

java.lang.Object
edu.macalester.graphics.GraphicsObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Arc, Button, Ellipse, GraphicsGroup, GraphicsText, Image, Line, Path, Rectangle, TextField
public abstract class GraphicsObject
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class representing some sort of graphical object that can be drawn and positioned in a canvaswindow.

  • Constructor Summary

    GraphicsObject()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addObserver​(GraphicsObserver observer)
    Adds an observer to be notified of visual changes to this graphics object (typically for the purpose of knowing when to draw it).

    Triggers a notifications to observers that this object's appearance has changed.

    For internal use.

    Returns the window that this Object is inside, or null if it does not belong to a window.

      public GraphicsObject()

  • Method Details

    • draw

      protected abstract void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D gc)
      For internal use. Draws this graphics object on the screen.

    • getPosition

      public abstract Point getPosition()
      Gets the position of the object on the canvas. The location of the anchor point that we call the “position” can vary, but is typically the upper left.

    • setPosition

      public abstract void setPosition​(double x, double y)
      Moves this object to the given position.
      Parameters:
      x - position
      y - position

    • setPosition

      public final void setPosition​(Point pos)
      Moves this object to the given position.

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Returns the object's current horizontal position.
      See Also:
      getPosition()

    • setX

      public void setX​(double x)
      Changes this object's horizontal position while preserving its vertical position.

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Returns the object's current vertical position.
      See Also:
      getPosition()

    • setY

      public void setY​(double y)
      Changes this object's vertical position while preserving its horizontal position.

    • getCenter

      public final Point getCenter()
      Returns the center of this shape's bounding box.

    • setCenter

      public final void setCenter​(double x, double y)
      Moves the shape so its bounding box is centered at the given point.

    • setCenter

      public final void setCenter​(Point point)
      Moves the shape so its bounding box is centered at the given point.

    • moveBy

      public final void moveBy​(double dx, double dy)
      Move the shape from its current (x, y) position to (x + dx, y + dy).

    • moveBy

      public void moveBy​(Point delta)
      Offsets the shape from its current position by the given delta.

    • testHit

      public abstract boolean testHit​(double x, double y)
      Tests whether the given point is on the boundary or interior of this graphic object's shape. The point is in this object's local coordinates, not canvas coordinates.

      Does not account for appearance, including stroke width and transparency.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds​(Point position)
      Returns true if the given point in the parent's coordinate space is within the bounds of this object. Note that testHit() actually checks the actual shape, whereas this method only tests the bounds. So, for example, a point in the upper left corner of an Ellipse’s bounding box could return true for isInBounds(), but false for testHit().

    • getElementAt

      public GraphicsObject getElementAt​(double x, double y)
      Returns the topmost graphical object that touches position x, y. If no such object exists, returns null. If this GraphicsObject has child elements, this method might return a child.
      Parameters:
      x - position in the coordinate space of this object’s container
      y - position in the coordinate space of this object’s container
      Returns:
      object at (x,y) or null if it does not exist.

    • getSize

      public Point getSize()
      Returns the width and height of this graphics object.

    • getBounds

      public abstract java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
      Returns an axis-aligned bounding rectangle for this graphical object.

    • getCanvas

      public CanvasWindow getCanvas()
      Returns the window that this Object is inside, or null if it does not belong to a window.

    • getEmbeddedComponent

      public javax.swing.JComponent getEmbeddedComponent()
      For internal use only. Supports UI components.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver​(GraphicsObserver observer)
      Adds an observer to be notified of visual changes to this graphics object (typically for the purpose of knowing when to draw it).

    • removeObserver

      public void removeObserver​(GraphicsObserver observer)
      Removes the given observer.

    • changed

      protected void changed()
      Triggers a notifications to observers that this object's appearance has changed. Subclasses should call this whenever anything changes that would alter this object's appearance.
